page.title: 17CANAL,STOKE PRIOR,BROMSGROVE
page.content: The canal flows from Birmingham to Worcester,down the Tardebigge flight of locks,through the village of Stoke Prior.A hundred years ago it was used to{transport salt}from John Corbett's works but now holiday makers travel its length in hired narrow boats.At Stoke Prior Wharf one can hire a boat from Black Prince Narrowboats Ltd.For a weeks{holiday}in August the cost would be from Â£340 for a 2-berth boat to Â£520 for eight people.This price includes everything required except food and personal linen. Canal boats are restricted to 4mph so avoiding bow-wave damage to the banks,but this gives time to enjoy the surrounding countryside.A popular activity associated with the canal is{ {fishing;}Stoke Prior children have caught gudgeon,roach,chubb,eels,and bream in the waters of their canal.
